remarks: Wilson's theorem.  A number is prime iff it is greater or equal to ` 2 ` and ` ( N - 1 ) ! ` is congruent to ` -u 1 ` , ` mod N ` , or alternatively if ` N ` divides ` ( N - 1 ) ! + 1 ` .  In this part of the proof we show the relatively simple reverse implication; see ~ wilthlem3 for the forward implication.  This is Metamath 100 proof #51.
